manager.columns.js

Summary
manager.columns.js
Options
columnsan array of objects defining columns.
addDefaultsdefault options to use in adding objects to a column
dragDefaultsDefault options used when making an object draggable.
Functions
addUse this method to add an element to the layout
serializeReturns an array of objects containing the following information for each object

Options

columns

an array of objects defining columns.  Default is an array of 3 columns in widths of 30%,*,25%

addDefaults

default options to use in adding objects to a column

dragDefaults

Default options used when making an object draggable.  These can be overridden when the object is passed to add().

Functions

add

add: function (elem,
options)

Use this method to add an element to the layout

Parameters

elemthe element to add.  Either a Dom Element or a Jx.Widget instance
optionsthe options to use in adding this elem.

Options

columnthe column to add to (zero-based)
positionwhere in the column to add (top | bottom | 0...n)
isDraggablewhether this elem should be draggable (doesn’t keep other elements from being added before or after)
handlethe part of the element to use as the drag handle

serialize

serialize: function ()

Returns an array of objects containing the following information for each object

{
    id: <object's id>,
    width: <object's width>,
    height: <object's height>,
    column: <column>,
    position: <position in the column>
 }

The array can be saved and used to recreate the layout.  This layout cannot recreate itself however.  The developer is tasked with taking this info and supplying the appropriate objects.

add: function (elem,
options)
Use this method to add an element to the layout
serialize: function ()
Returns an array of objects containing the following information for each object
